channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report X-2023120679
item.description:
Report X-2023120679

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-10
  • City: DUBLIN
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was pulled off the trailer and the bottom of the box was damp. Upon discovery that it was a hazmat package, it was removed from the sort, placed in a lined hazmat tote and taken to the hazmat cage to be held for inspection. DescribePack: On inspection, 4 4 liter glass jugs were found, 1 of which had no lid in place. Visual inspection determined that approximately .5 liters had leaked out of the jug and into the box, soaking into the corrugated inner liner and the bottom of the box. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Removed the package from the sort, to prevent leakage onto other packages, placed it in a lined hazmat tote and placed it in the hazmat cage for inspection.

item.title: Report X-2023120337
item.description:
Report X-2023120337

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-03
  • City: NORFOLK
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: IN THE UNLOAD, THE DAMAGED HAZMAT WAS IN THE UNLOADING TRAILER FOUND BY A PACKAGE HANDLER LEAKING FROM THE BOTTOM OF THE CAN DescribePack: DURING THE INSPECTION, THERE WAS A CRACKING UNDER THE CAN LEAKING GAS. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: THE DAMAGED METAL DRUM WAS PLACED INSIDE OF A SAFETY CONTAINER TO PREVENT OTHER PACKAGES FROM GETTING WET

item.title: Report X-2023120273
item.description:
Report X-2023120273

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: MANASSAS
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND IN THE UNLOAD AR DOOR 6 T-828828 UNDER BOXES BY THE MANAGER AND GIVEN TO QA AT 6:13AM. THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND UPON INSPECTION , THE CAP ON THE CONTENT WAS LOOSE CAUSING INTERNAL LEAKAGE EMPTYING IT HALFWAY. OP900 WET DescribePack: PACKAGE CAP WAS NOT PROPERLY CLOSES. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: HAZMAT WAS PUT ONTO A BIN AMD PKG CAP WAS CLOSE PROPERLY

item.title: Report E-2023120127
item.description:
Report E-2023120127

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: COLONIAL HGTS
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 30, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of hydrochloric acid was damaged by an unknown cause and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the hydrochloric acid-impacted trailer interior/dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents, impacted cardboard and shrink wrap were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The one (1) 5-gallon damaged jug was over-packed into one (1) 55-gallon drum, both for terminal disposal.
